ai.summary: Beech Trail is a moderate 8.1 km hike through UK beech woodland. It combines pleasant forest scenery, gentle elevation changes and steady woodland paths, making it suitable for walkers with a reasonable level of fitness seeking an outdoor forest experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows forest tracks and dirt paths with some exposed roots and occasional damp patches. Expect mostly well-defined trails, light to moderate ascents, and mud after rainfall; conditions can vary with season and weather.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths, carry a map or offline navigation and keep a charged phone. Bring water and a snack, and be mindful of slippery leaves after rain. Let someone know your plans and time estimates. Watch for cyclists on shared sections and be cautious on uneven ground.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal for Beech Trail, offering milder weather and drier trails; winters can be muddy with shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Beech Trail — 8.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
